trans-unit.source: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication - Getting Started
trans-unit.target: Azure Multi-Factor Authentication - Getting Started

trans-unit.source: Choose the multi-factor authentication secutiry solution that is right for you by asking what am i trying to secure and where are my users located.
trans-unit.target: Choose the multi-factor authentication secutiry solution that is right for you by asking what am i trying to secure and where are my users located.

trans-unit.source: Then choose cloud, MFA Server or AD FS.
trans-unit.target: Then choose cloud, MFA Server or AD FS.

trans-unit.source: Choose the multi-factor security solution for you
trans-unit.target: Choose the multi-factor security solution for you

trans-unit.source: Because there are several flavors of Azure Multi-Factor Authentication we must determine a couple of things in order to figure out which version is the proper one to use.
trans-unit.target: Because there are several flavors of Azure Multi-Factor Authentication we must determine a couple of things in order to figure out which version is the proper one to use.

trans-unit.source: Those things are:
trans-unit.target: Those things are:

trans-unit.source: What am I trying to secure
trans-unit.target: What am I trying to secure

trans-unit.source: Where are the users located
trans-unit.target: Where are the users located

trans-unit.source: The following sections will provide guidance on determining each of these.
trans-unit.target: The following sections will provide guidance on determining each of these.

trans-unit.source: What am I trying to secure?
trans-unit.target: What am I trying to secure?

trans-unit.source: In order to determine the correct multi-factor authentication solution, first we must answer the question of what are you trying to secure with a second method of authentication.
trans-unit.target: In order to determine the correct multi-factor authentication solution, first we must answer the question of what are you trying to secure with a second method of authentication.

trans-unit.source: Is it an application that is in Azure?
trans-unit.target: Is it an application that is in Azure?

trans-unit.source: Or is it a remote access system for example.
trans-unit.target: Or is it a remote access system for example.

trans-unit.source: By determining what we are trying to secure, we will see to answer the question of where multi-factor authentication needs to be enabled.
trans-unit.target: By determining what we are trying to secure, we will see to answer the question of where multi-factor authentication needs to be enabled.

trans-unit.source: What are you trying to secure
trans-unit.target: What are you trying to secure

trans-unit.source: Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud
trans-unit.target: Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud

trans-unit.source: Multi-Factor Authentication Server
trans-unit.target: Multi-Factor Authentication Server

trans-unit.source: First party Microsoft apps
trans-unit.target: First party Microsoft apps

trans-unit.source: Saas apps in the app gallery
trans-unit.target: Saas apps in the app gallery

trans-unit.source: IIS applications published through Azure AD App Proxy
trans-unit.target: IIS applications published through Azure AD App Proxy

trans-unit.source: IIS applications not published through Azure AD App Proxy
trans-unit.target: IIS applications not published through Azure AD App Proxy

trans-unit.source: Remote access such as VPN, RDG
trans-unit.target: Remote access such as VPN, RDG

trans-unit.source: Where are the users located
trans-unit.target: Where are the users located

trans-unit.source: Next, depending on where are users are located, we can determine the correct solution to use, whether it is mutli-factor authentication in the cloud or on-premises using the MFA Server.
trans-unit.target: Next, depending on where are users are located, we can determine the correct solution to use, whether it is mutli-factor authentication in the cloud or on-premises using the MFA Server.

trans-unit.source: User Location
trans-unit.target: User Location

trans-unit.source: Solution
trans-unit.target: Solution

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud
trans-unit.target: Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud

trans-unit.source: Azure AD and on-premises AD using federation with AD FS
trans-unit.target: Azure AD and on-premises AD using federation with AD FS

trans-unit.source: Both MFA in the cloud and MFA Server are available options
trans-unit.target: Both MFA in the cloud and MFA Server are available options

trans-unit.source: Azure AD and on-premises AD using DirSync, Azure AD Sync, Azure AD Connect - no password sync
trans-unit.target: Azure AD and on-premises AD using DirSync, Azure AD Sync, Azure AD Connect - no password sync

trans-unit.source: Both MFA in the cloud and MFA Server are available options
trans-unit.target: Both MFA in the cloud and MFA Server are available options

trans-unit.source: Azure AD and on-premises AD using DirSync, Azure AD Sync, Azure AD Connect - with password sync
trans-unit.target: Azure AD and on-premises AD using DirSync, Azure AD Sync, Azure AD Connect - with password sync

trans-unit.source: Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud
trans-unit.target: Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud

trans-unit.source: On-premises Active Directory
trans-unit.target: On-premises Active Directory

trans-unit.source: Multi-Factor Authentication Server
trans-unit.target: Multi-Factor Authentication Server

trans-unit.source: The following table is a comparison of the features that are a with Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud and with the Multi-Factor Authentication Server.
trans-unit.target: The following table is a comparison of the features that are a with Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud and with the Multi-Factor Authentication Server.

trans-unit.source: | Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud | Multi-Factor Authentication Server
trans-unit.target: | Multi-Factor Authentication in the cloud | Multi-Factor Authentication Server

trans-unit.source: Mobile app notification as a second factor | ● | ● |
trans-unit.target: Mobile app notification as a second factor | ● | ● |

trans-unit.source: Mobile app verification code as a second factor | ● | ●
trans-unit.target: Mobile app verification code as a second factor | ● | ●

trans-unit.source: Phone call as second factor | ● | ●
trans-unit.target: Phone call as second factor | ● | ●

trans-unit.source: One-way SMS as second factor | ● | ●
trans-unit.target: One-way SMS as second factor | ● | ●

trans-unit.source: Two-way SMS as second factor | | ●
trans-unit.target: Two-way SMS as second factor | | ●

trans-unit.source: Hardware Tokens as second factor | | ●
trans-unit.target: Hardware Tokens as second factor | | ●

trans-unit.source: App passwords for clients that don’t support MFA | ● |
trans-unit.target: App passwords for clients that don’t support MFA | ● |

trans-unit.source: Admin control over authentication methods | | ●
trans-unit.target: Admin control over authentication methods | | ●

trans-unit.source: PIN mode | | ●
trans-unit.target: PIN mode | | ●

trans-unit.source: Fraud alert | ● | ●
trans-unit.target: Fraud alert | ● | ●

trans-unit.source: MFA Reports | ● | ●
trans-unit.target: MFA Reports | ● | ●

trans-unit.source: One-Time Bypass | ● | ●
trans-unit.target: One-Time Bypass | ● | ●

trans-unit.source: Custom greetings for phone calls | ● | ●
trans-unit.target: Custom greetings for phone calls | ● | ●

trans-unit.source: Customizable caller ID for phone calls | ● | ●
trans-unit.target: Customizable caller ID for phone calls | ● | ●

trans-unit.source: Trusted IPs | ● | ●
trans-unit.target: Trusted IPs | ● | ●

trans-unit.source: Suspend MFA for remembered devices (Public Preview) | ● |
trans-unit.target: Suspend MFA for remembered devices (Public Preview) | ● |

trans-unit.source: Conditional access | ● | ●
trans-unit.target: Conditional access | ● | ●

trans-unit.source: Cache | ● | ●
trans-unit.target: Cache | ● | ●

trans-unit.source: Now that we have determined whether to use cloud multi-factor authentication or the MFA Server on-premises, we can get started setting up and using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication.
trans-unit.target: Now that we have determined whether to use cloud multi-factor authentication or the MFA Server on-premises, we can get started setting up and using Azure Multi-Factor Authentication.

trans-unit.source: **Select the icon that represents your scenario!**
trans-unit.target: **Select the icon that represents your scenario!**
